snippet: Investigators interviewed Ms. Lee and found “she has opinions and seems to be aware of what is going on with her book and the book deal,” a regulator said.
abstract: Alabama Securities Commission, which has been helping with investigation into whether author Harper Lee, 88 and infirm, was cajoled into agreeing to publish second novel in summer 2015, says it has ended its role in probe; friends say she is lucid and excited about book, Go Set a Watchman.
lead_paragraph: Investigators interviewed Ms. Lee and found “she has opinions and seems to be aware of what is going on with her book and the book deal,” a regulator said.

headline.main: One Agency in Harper Lee Inquiry Ends Its Role, Saying Author Is ‘Aware’ of Book Deal
headline.print_headline: Agency Ends Its Portion of Inquiry in Lee Novel
